Authors: Wisnalmawati, Huda C., Ningrum I.K., Lukiyanto K.
Title: Web application facilities can build academic atmospere promotion student satisfaction in college
Source title: International Journal of Scientific and Technology Research
Affiliations: Faculty Of Economic and Business, Pembangunan Nasional “Veteran” University, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Faculty of Technology and Design, Bina Nusantara Institude of Creative Technology, Indonesia; Economic Education Departmen, FPIPS IKIP PGRI Bojonegoro, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Wisnalmawati, Faculty Of Economic and Business, Pembangunan Nasional “Veteran” University, Yogyakarta, Indonesia; Huda, C., Faculty of Technology and Design, Bina Nusantara Institude of Creative Technology, Indonesia; Ningrum, I.K., Economic Education Departmen, FPIPS IKIP PGRI Bojonegoro, Indonesia; Lukiyanto, K., Bina Nusantara Institute of Creative Technology, Indonesia
Abstract: Teaching and learning processes are facilitated through face-to-face and online activities. The web application facility allows students to easily find information related to education and the business world. This study aims to analyze the direct and indirect (mediated by the academic atmosphere) effects of web application facilities on student satisfaction. Research respondents were Postgraduate Program students majoring in Management Masters. Structural Equational Model (SEM) with PLS and SPSS Program were used in the data processing. The results of this study indicate that (1) Web application facilities did not have effects on student satisfaction; (2) The application facilities affect student satisfaction if mediated by the academic atmosphere. There has not been much research in Indonesia because the web usage program is new in Indonesian education. The research results contribute to the development of consumer behavior models. Web application facilities assist soft data storage for accreditation purposes and accelerating graduation of quality students to construct a conducive atmosphere affecting student satisfaction. © IJSTR 2019.
Author Keywords: Academic; Application; Atmosphere; Facilities; Satisfaction; Student; Web

Title: Facebook Analytics on Building Trust for E-Commerce in Indonesia - A study of Shopee and Tokopedia
Source title: Proceedings of 2019 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2019
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ibrahim, I.I., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Huda, C., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Social media is a term used to describe a collection of popular platforms to contribute and share information. Growth in the use of social media is forcing companies to use social media as their marketing tools to enhance relationships with consumers and to create brand awareness. The authors observed how e-commerce websites in Indonesia benefit from the use of social media for their business, focusing on the correlations of the Facebook content posted by the two top e-commerce sites in Indonesia - Shopee and Tokopedia - to build trust among consumers. Linear regression analysis was used to determine the impact of the content posted by the company, and the number of comments and likes. For the purposes of this study, 'number of shares' was used as a proxy for trust. The results of the analysis showed a significant impact among trust, posts, comments, and likes. At the end of the study we made a social media share software application design with a Waterfall design method and object-oriented programming concept. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: facebook; shopee; social media; social media analytics; tokopedia
Index Keywords: Application programs; Electronic commerce; Information management; Object oriented programming; Regression analysis; Facebook; shopee; Social media; Social media analytics; tokopedia; Social networking (online)
